metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AngularJS Animations
AngularJS provides animated transitions, with help from CSS.
content.html: AngularJS provides animated transitions, with help from CSS.

content.text: What is an Animation?
An animation is when the transformation of an HTML element gives you an illusion of motion.
content.html: An animation is when the transformation of an HTML element gives you an illusion of motion.

content.code: Hide the DIV:
content.code_html:
<body ng-app="ngAnimate">

Hide the DIV: <input type="checkbox" ng-model="myCheck">

<div ng-hide="myCheck"></div>

</body>

content.text: Applications should not be filled with animations, but some animations can make the application easier to understand.
content.html: Applications should not be filled with animations, but some animations can make the application easier to understand.

content.text: What do I Need?
To make your applications ready for animations, you must include the AngularJS Animate library:
content.html: To make your applications ready for animations, you must include the AngularJS Animate library:

content.code_html: <script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/angularjs/1.6.9/angular-animate.js"></script>

content.text: Then you must refer to the ngAnimate module in your application:
content.html: Then you must refer to the ngAnimate module in your application:

content.code_html: <body ng-app="ngAnimate">

content.text: Or if your application has a name, add ngAnimate as a dependency in your application module:
content.html: Or if your application has a name, add ngAnimate as a dependency in your application module:

content.code_html:
<body ng-app="myApp">

<h1>Hide the DIV: <input type="checkbox" ng-model="myCheck"></h1>

<div ng-hide="myCheck"></div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', ['ngAnimate']);
</script>

content.text: What Does ngAnimate Do?
The ngAnimate module adds and removes classes.
content.html: The ngAnimate module adds and removes classes.

content.text: The ngAnimate module does not animate your HTML elements, but when ngAnimate notice certain events, like hide or show of an HTML element, the element gets some pre-defined classes which can be used to make animations.
content.html: The ngAnimate module does not animate your HTML elements, but when ngAnimate notice certain events, like hide or show of an HTML element, the element gets some pre-defined classes which can be used to make animations.

content.text: The directives in AngularJS who add/remove classes are:
content.html: The directives in AngularJS who add/remove classes are:

content.text: The ng-show and ng-hide directives adds or removes a ng-hide class value.
content.html: The ng-show and ng-hide directives adds or removes a ng-hide class value.

content.text: The other directives adds a ng-enter class value when they enter the DOM, and a ng-leave attribute when they are removed from the DOM.
content.html: The other directives adds a ng-enter class value when they enter the DOM, and a ng-leave attribute when they are removed from the DOM.

content.text: The ng-repeat directive also adds a ng-move class value when the HTML element changes position.
content.html: The ng-repeat directive also adds a ng-move class value when the HTML element changes position.

content.text: In addition, during the animation, the HTML element will have a set of class values, which will be removed when the animation has finished. Example: the ng-hide directive will add these class values:
content.html: In addition, during the animation, the HTML element will have a set of class values, which will be removed when the animation has finished. Example: the ng-hide directive will add these class values:

content.text: Animations Using CSS
We can use CSS transitions or CSS animations to animate HTML elements. This tutorial will show you both.
content.html: We can use CSS transitions or CSS animations to animate HTML elements. This tutorial will show you both.

content.text: To learn more about CSS Animation, study our CSS Transition Tutorial and our CSS Animation Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about CSS Animation, study our CSS Transition Tutorial and our CSS Animation Tutorial.

content.text: CSS Transitions
CSS transitions allows you to change CSS property values smoothly, from one value to another, over a given duration:
content.html: CSS transitions allows you to change CSS property values smoothly, from one value to another, over a given duration:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
div {  transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;}.ng-hide 
    {  height: 0;}
transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;

content.code:
<style>div {  transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;}.ng-hide 
{  height: 0;}</style>

syntax_highlighting.text:
div {  transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;}.ng-hide 
    {  height: 0;}
transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;

content.code_html:
<style>
div {
  transition: all linear 0.5s;
  background-color: lightblue;
  height: 100px;
}

.ng-hide {
  height: 0;
}
</style>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
div {  transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;}.ng-hide 
    {  height: 0;}
transition: all linear 0.5s;  background-color: lightblue;  height: 100px;

content.text: CSS Animations
CSS Animations allows you to change CSS property values smoothly, from one value to another, over a given duration:
content.html: CSS Animations allows you to change CSS property values smoothly, from one value to another, over a given duration:

content.code:
<style>@keyframes myChange {  from {    
height: 100px;  } to {    height: 0;
}}div {  height: 100px;  background-color: lightblue;}
div.ng-hide {  animation: 0.5s myChange;}</style>
content.code_html:
<style>
@keyframes myChange {
  from {
    height: 100px;
  } to {
    height: 0;
  }
}

div {
  height: 100px;
  background-color: lightblue;
}

div.ng-hide {
  animation: 0.5s myChange;
}
</style>
